text: The Electoral district of North Esk was a single-member electoral district of the Tasmanian House of Assembly. It was based near Tasmania's second city of Launceston. The seat was created in a redistribution ahead of the 1903 state election out of the former seats of Selby and Evandale, and was abolished when the Tasmanian parliament adopted the Hare-Clark electoral model in 1909. ==Members for North Esk== {| class="wikitable" |- !colspan="2"|Member!!Term |- | | John Gibson | 1903–1906 |- | | Richard McKenzie | 1906–1909 |} ==References== * * * Parliament of Tasmania (2006). The Parliament of Tasmania from 1956 North Esk Category:1909 disestablishments in Australia
title: Electoral district of North Esk
